text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm palisa A Cloud support
engineer here at the AWS office in Cape
Town South Africa
today I'm going to show you how to
remove the restriction on Port 25 from
your Amazon ec2 instance or AWS Lambda
function let's get started
Amazon ec2 restricts traffic on Port 25
for all its instances however you can
request that this restriction be removed
after logging into the AWS Management
console if you are using Route 53 for
DNS navigate to the Amazon Route 53
console however if you are using a
third-party service for DNS contact your
DNS provider so that they can create an
area code for you the area code must
point to the elastic IP of your ec2
instance that will be hosting the SMTP
service
she's the hottest Zone and select your
hosted soul
choose create record
enter the name of the SMTP server in the
record name field
enter the elastic IP address of your ec2
instance in the text box leave the
record type as a Roots traffic to ipv4
address and some other AWS resource and
then select simple routing
choose create records
to request that AWS removed the
restriction on Port 25 to support center
and select create case
select service limit increase
search for the ec2 email in the limit
type
and then choose ec2 link
enter your email address in the email
address text box as well as a
description in the use case description
text box
you can also insert the AWS owned
elastic IP address and the reverse DNS
require that AWS must associate with the
elastic IP addresses
choose submit
after your request is approved you will
receive an email stating that the port
25 restrictions are removed and that's
how you remove the restriction on Port
25 from your ec2 instance or Lambda
function
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
